subSubSection.paragraph:
Comibaena reflexaria Walker, [1863]
1862: 1565. Locus typicus: Sierra Leone , 42-31 [pres. By Revd. D.F. Morgan ] ( Lectotype designated by Swinhoe, 1904 , without abdomen in NHMUK).

Genetic data. BIN : BOLD :ABZ6643 (n=6 from Ethiopia ; n= 5 from Cameroon , Uganda , Kenya ; maximum variation 1.0%). Nearest species:
Z. rhamphis Fletcher, 1974
(1.8%).

Distribution. Angola , Cameroon , Central African Republic , Democratic Republic of the Congo , Côte d’Ivoire , Equatorial Guinea , Ethiopia , Ghana , Guinea , Kenya , Madagascar , Nigeria , Sierra Leone , South Africa , Tanzania , Uganda ( Fletcher 1974 ; Herbulot 1977 ; Beck & Karisch 2011 ; Sircoulomb 2013 ). The subspecies
Z. reflexaria apsis
is known from central and eastern Africa ( Fletcher 1974 ).

caption.paragraph:
FIGURES 42–47. Male genitalia of Ethiopian
Zamarada
species. Scale Bar(s)—1 mm. In parantheses the ID-numbers of genitalia slides are given. 42.
Zamarada erugatoides
sp.n. (gen.prp. ZSM G 20200, paratype); 43.
Zamarada pulverosa Warren, 1895
(gen.prp. ZSM G 20353); 44.
Zamarada torrida Fletcher, 1974
(gen.prp. ZSM G 20302); 45.
Zamarada hyalinaria (Guenée, 1857)
(gen.prp. ZSM G 20955); 46.
Zamarada melasma Fletcher, 1974
(gen.prp. ZSM G 20195); 47.
Zamarada ilma Prout, 1922
(gen.prp. ZSM G 20356).

subSubSection.paragraph:
Remarks. Ethiopian populations show a slight genetic divergence from other specimens of
Z. reflexaria
. Female genitalia of one specimen well corresponding to the figure of
Z. cucharita
Fletcher, 1974
in the original description. Shape of the antrum is clearly tapered while it is truncate and dentate in
Z. reflexaria
. More material (males, other DNA barcodes) is needed to check the potential occurrence of
Z. cucharita
in Ethiopia .
